lead_paragraph: The plan is intended to free consumers from renting the boxes, which cost them $231 a year on average.

headline.print_headline: Vote Delayed on a Plan to Let People Pick Their Cable Box
headline.main: F.C.C. Delays Vote on Cable Set-Top Boxes

snippet: The plan is intended to free consumers from renting the boxes, which cost them $231 a year on average....
abstract: Federal Communication Commission temporarily delays voting on proposal that would free cable customers from renting television set-up boxes from cable operators and allow them to buy alternative devices; FCC officials say intention is to increase competition in television industry and save individual consumers as much as $231 in annual cable box fees.
